hanzi-su-wiki:
幅

Значения

Ширина; свиток, рулон, счётный суффикс для свитков и рулонов

Мнемоника

То, чем богата (富 без крыши) ткань 巾, её ширина. Богатство — в количестве, у кого-то его больше, у других — меньше.
purpleculture_pinyin:
fú
width; roll; classifier for textiles or pictures
ширина; рулон; классификатор для текстиля или картинок
rtega_mnemonic:
幅幅RSpiece, strip, hanging scroll, breadth of, hem, width
  • piece of hanging scroll 巾 painted with ink from a pot 畐 over the entire width
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: A roll 畐 of cloth 巾; 畐 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
大幅 [ dà fú ]: a big margin; substantially
增幅 [ zēng fú ]: growth rate; amplification
幅度 [ fú dù ]: width; extent; range; scope
横幅 [ héng fú ]: horizontal scroll; banner; streamer
涨幅 [ zhǎng fú ]: extent of a rise (in prices etc); amount of increase; growth (typically expressed as a percentage)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 巾 [ jīn ] cloth, curtain, handkerchief, towel
    • 畐 [ fú ] to fill; a roll of cloth
heisig_chinese_memo: The wealthy have weird trends and the current one is using towels which are the only the width of a cloth, but are really long to make up for it.
heisig_constituent: hanging scroll, towel, wealth, one, ceiling, mouth, rice field, brains
heisig_story: A towel owned by the wealthiest tycoon in the world is made into a hanging scroll after his death and auctioned off to the highest bidder.
koohiiStory1: In the west, the rich use $100 bills to light their cigars... In Japan, after showering, when the wealthy don´t have any clean towels, they simply grab a hanging scroll off the wall and use it to dry off!
koohiiStory2: The towels of the wealthy: hanging scrolls.
jp_example_words:
大幅(おおはば): full width, large scale, drastic
幅(はば): width, breadth
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You want to put this towel over this scarecrow, but you have to measure its width first. If the towel doesn't have a greater width than the scarecrow, some of it will be showing. Which you definitely don't want.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The scarecrow creeps you out. You don't want to look at it anymore, so you're standing eerily close to it measuring its width, so you can hide it forever.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You finish measuring the the width of the scarecrow and the width of the towel, and you realize you're the width of a habanero (はば) pepper short. This is fine, you grow those. This is a whole field of habaneros! So you pluck one off the nearest plant, tape it to the cloth, and cover that scarecrow right up.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Do you know the width of a habanero? It's one scarecrow minus one cloth.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 副 (フク вспомогательный), 復 (また、フク восстановление), 福 (フク счастье).
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 口 (рот), 巾 (тряпка), 田 (рисовое поле)
Ru_trainchinese:
fú: (сч.слово/сущ) счетное слово для картин, гравюр и т.д.; ширина (ткани)
fú: (графема) (общий термин) ширина, размах, степень, размер
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the turban (巾) that fills (畐) has breadth
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The wealthy have weird trends and the current one is using towels which are the only the width of a cloth, but are really long to make up for it.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " towel " and "畐", the original meaning is the width of the cloth, and the ancient one is two feet and two inches. "Shuowen": "The cloth and silk are wide. From the towel, the sound of the sound." "The Book of Rites-Wang Zhi": "The cloth and silk are not medium, wide and narrow, not in the market."

" Width " can refer to the fate of clothes. "Ritual ‧ mourning clothes": "Where the decay is cut outside, the inside of the garment is cut."

" Width " also means limit. "Twenty-eight years of Zuo Zhuan‧ Xianggong": "The husband and the people have a strong livelihood and use profit, so it depends on the righteous virtue." Kong Yingdashu: "Use the righteous virtue as the margin, so that there is a degree."

" Width " also refers to cloth and silk. "Book of Jin-Legend of Siyi-Japanese": "The man's clothes have banners, but they are connected at the end and are slightly seamless."

" Width " also refers to length. Qing Li Yu's "Illustration of Leisure, Care and Joy": "The cool summer is terrifying. Although the front is exposed, it is not the same as the heat."

" Width " is also used as a quantifier, used for cloth or paper. Southern Song Shenghong's "Jingzhou Ji": "There is Shifan Mountain in Wuyang County, Wuling, like hundreds of sails."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " scarf " and "畐", the original meaning is the width of the cloth. The ancient one is two feet and two inches.
humanum_full_description:
從「巾」，「畐」聲，本義為布帛的寬度，古制一幅為二尺二寸。《說文》：「布帛廣也。从巾，畐聲。」《禮記‧王制》：「布帛精麤不中數，幅廣狹不中量，不粥於市。」

　　「幅」可指衣裳的緣飾。《儀禮‧喪服》：「凡衰外削幅，裳內削幅。」

　　「幅」也表示限度。《左傳‧襄公二十八年》：「夫民生厚而用利，於是乎正德以幅之。」孔穎達疏：「言用正德以為邊幅，使有度也。」

　　「幅」也指布帛。《晉書‧四夷傳‧倭人》：「其男子衣以橫幅，但結束相連，略無縫綴。」

　　「幅」亦指篇幅。清李漁《閑情偶寄‧頤養‧行樂》：「酷夏之可畏，前幅雖露其端，然未盡暑毒之什一也。」

　　「幅」還用作量詞，用於布帛或紙張等。南朝宋盛弘之〈荊州記〉：「武陵武陽縣有石帆山，若數百幅帆。」
humanum_short_description: 從「巾」，「畐」聲，本義為布帛的寬度，古制一幅為二尺二寸。

從「 巾 」，「 畐 」聲，本義為布帛的寬度，古制一幅為二尺二寸。《說文》：「布帛廣也。从巾，畐聲。」《禮記‧王制》：「布帛精麤不中數，幅廣狹不中量，不粥於市。」 「 幅 」可指衣裳的緣飾。《儀禮‧喪服》：「凡衰外削幅，裳內削幅。」 「 幅 」也表示限度。《左傳‧襄公二十八年》：「夫民生厚而用利，於是乎正德以幅之。」孔穎達疏：「言用正德以為邊幅，使有度也。」 「 幅 」也指布帛。《晉書‧四夷傳‧倭人》：「其男子衣以橫幅，但結束相連，略無縫綴。」 「 幅 」亦指篇幅。清李漁《閑情偶寄‧頤養‧行樂》：「酷夏之可畏，前幅雖露其端，然未盡暑毒之什一也。」 「 幅 」還用作量詞，用於布帛或紙張等。南朝宋盛弘之〈荊州記〉：「武陵武陽縣有石帆山，若數百幅帆。」
From the sound of " towel" and " 畐", the original meaning is the width of the cloth, and the ancient one is two feet and two inches. "Shuowen": "The cloth and silk are wide. From the towel, the sound of the sound." "The Book of Rites-Wang Zhi": "The cloth and silk are not medium, wide and narrow, not in the market." " Width" can refer to the fate of clothes. "Ritual ‧ mourning clothes": "Where the decay is cut outside, the inside of the garment is cut." " Width" also means limit. "Twenty-eight years of Zuo Zhuan‧ Xianggong": "The husband and the people have a strong livelihood and use profit, so it depends on the righteous virtue." Kong Yingdashu: "Use the righteous virtue as the margin, so that there is a degree." " Width" also refers to cloth and silk. "Book of Jin-Legend of Siyi-Japanese": "The man's clothes have banners, but they are connected at the end and are slightly seamless." " Width" also refers to length. Qing Li Yu's "Illustration of Leisure, Care and Joy": "The cool summer is terrifying. Although the front is exposed, it is not the same as the heat." " Width" is also used as a quantifier, used for cloth or paper. Southern Song Shenghong's "Jingzhou Ji": "There is Shifan Mountain in Wuyang County, Wuling, like hundreds of sails."

幅字的基本解释

幅
fú
布的宽度：幅面。双幅。宽幅。
泛指事物的宽度：幅度。幅员（“幅”是宽度，“员”是周围。指疆域或领土的面积。如“我国幅幅广大”）。振幅。篇幅。
边缘：边幅。
量词，用于布帛、图画等：一幅画。五幅布。

幅字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fú］
［《廣韻》方六切，入屋，非。］
(1)布帛的宽度。古制一幅为二尺二寸。
(2)泛指宽度。参见“幅隕”、“幅度”。
(3)谓使有限度。
(4)衣裳的缘饰。
(5)指布帛。
(6)谓织成布帛。
(7)指书信。
(8)指篇幅。
(9)覆盖。
(10)量词。用于布帛或纸张等。
[②]［bī］
［《廣韻》彼側切，入職，幫。］
斜缠于胫的布帛，自足至膝，似今之绑腿布，古称行縢。

幅字的英文翻译

◎ 幅
breadth

幅字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【巾字部】　幅； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页334第21
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?方六切，音福。【說文】布帛廣也。【玉篇】布帛廣狹。【廣韻】絹幅。【爾雅·釋天】緇廣充幅，長尋曰旐。【疏】以黑色之帛，廣全幅長八尺，屬於杠，名旐。【急就篇註】四丈曰疋，兩邊具曰幅。【左傳·襄二十八年】夫富，如布帛之有幅焉，爲之制度，使無遷也。夫民生厚而用利於是乎，正德以幅之。【疏】言用正德以爲邊幅，使有度也。【前漢·馬援傳】修飾邊幅。【註】若布帛，修飾其邊幅也。　又【廣雅】匡幅，滿也。　又【廣韻】姓也。　又【廣韻】彼側切【集韻】【韻會】筆力切，?音逼。【廣韻】行縢名。【左傳·桓二年】帶裳幅舄。【註】幅若今行縢。【詩·小雅】邪幅在下。【傳】幅，逼也，所以自偪束也。正義邪纏於足謂之邪偪。名曰偪者，所以自偪束也。　又【韻會】通作偪。【禮·內則】偪屨著綦。

考證：〔【禮·內則】偪屨著綦。【註】鄭云，以幅帛邪纏於足，所以自偪束。逼卽縢約也。〕　謹按內則無此註，查係小雅疏，而又非原文。謹移於
幅字的源字形

幅字的起名意思

幅是个多音字，念fú时，意指幅面，布、绸、呢绒等的宽度，边缘等。念bī时， 指斜缠于胫的布帛，自足至膝，似今之绑腿布，古称行縢。

Width
Basic explanation of words
Width
fú
The width of the cloth: breadth. Double width. Wide.
Refers to the width of things in general: amplitude. Width ("width" is the width, and "member" is the surrounding area. Refers to the area of the territory or territory. For example, "my country is vast"). amplitude. space.
Edge: The margin.
Quantifier, used for cloth, pictures, etc.: a picture. Five pieces of cloth.

The cloth wrapped obliquely around the shin, from its feet to the knees, resembles today's leggings cloth, which was called Xinghu in ancient times.

Width
Source glyph
Width
Name meaning
Width is a polyphonic character. When pronounced fú, it means the width and edge of the cloth, silk, woolen cloth, etc. When chanting bī, it refers to the cloth wrapped obliquely around the shin, from its feet to the knees, like today's leggings cloth.
形声字。巾表意,其形像一块布或头巾,表示和纺织品有关;高(fa)表声,高有满义,将布帛展开才能知其幅面,展开
即有布满的意思。本义是布、帛等的宽度。

Шарф представляет значение, его форма похожа на кусок ткани или головной платок, что означает, что он связан с тканью; высокий (фа) выражает звук, высокий полон смысла, а ширина ткани может быть известна. когда ткань развернута.
Первоначальное значение - ширина ткани, шелка и т. Д.

画一幅画 нарисовать одну картину
2) fú ширина ткани; площадь, поверхность
两幅布 ткань двойной ширины
3) fú край (кромка) штуки ткани; граница, край; предел
4) fú размах; физ. амплитуда
振幅 амплитуда колебаний
5) bī* обмотки (наногах)
II гл. bì
* соответствовать, отвечать
位不幅德 положение не отвечает качествам (человека)
Radicals: 巾, 畐  (towel, scarecrow)
Meaning Mnemonic
You want to put this towel over this scarecrow, but you have to measure its width first. If the towel doesn't have a greater width than the scarecrow, some of it will be showing. Which you definitely don't want.
The scarecrow creeps you out. You don't want to look at it anymore, so you're standing eerily close to it measuring its width, so you can hide it forever.
Reading Mnemonic
You finish measuring the the width of the scarecrow and the width of the towel, and you realize you're the width of a habanero (はば) pepper short. This is fine, you grow those. This is a whole field of habaneros! So you pluck one off the nearest plant, tape it to the cloth, and cover that scarecrow right up.
Do you know the width of a habanero? It's one scarecrow minus one cloth.

Examples: 幅 (はば)
一 (один), 口 (рот), 巾 (тряпка), 田 (рисовое поле)
Не путать: 副 (フク вспомогательный), 復 (また、フク восстановление), 福 (フク счастье).
